published.title: Why I Don't Use Piazza
published.description: Piazza is not a forum and doesn't effectively build community. If you are using it, please consider stopping. There are much better alternatives.

published.title: Chalkface Nostalgia
published.description: With the pandemic seemingly drawing to a close, at least in the United States, it’s disappointing to see university students, administrators, and even instructors longing to return to outmoded and ineffective instructional methods. It’s not just a return to campus. It’s a return to classrooms, and to droning at the chalkface.

published.title: Recipe Programming
published.description: Recipe programming comprises working of a set of instructions to produce a program that achieves some desired outcome. The language, environment, and task most strongly associated with recipe programming is Python in a Jupyter Notebook to perform data analysis and visualization. While recipe programming is powerful and useful, it should not be confused with scratch programming, particularly when teaching CS1.
